lexUnit.name: head.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be or act as the head of.

sentence.text: He also headed a number of Courtaulds ' textile businesses at different times but it was mainly his knowledge of viscose which earned him a reputation as a leading world authority on the fibre .
Art historians conclude that William de Brailes headed a workshop of manuscript artists based at his tenement in Catte Street .
In practice most powers are delegated to the Official Secretary , who heads the Office of Tokelau Affairs .
The firm 's managing director , Bob Robison , who had headed the firm for 12 years , said : ` We are delighted to have secured our future as a local firm .
George Yeo was appointed to head the new Ministry for Information and Arts and also as Second Minister for Foreign Affairs .
ARMY spy Brian Nelson has been interviewed again by top cop John Stevens , who headed an investigation into alleged collusion between members of the security forces and loyalist paramilitaries .
* A well known Radio Forth RFM presenter will head the campaign .
The operation will be headed by Jeff Davies , former managing director of FSO Cars .
Most lone parent families are headed by women ; just 10 per cent are lone fathers .
The church itself was headed by elderly archbishops and the law by aged judges .
Meanwhile , IXI is also in the process of setting up a European operation , which is being headed by Steven Sampson as general manager .
Longman Asia ELT will be headed up by Dugie Cameron , who moves from Tokyo to Hong Kong to become its director .
Ms Becker has headed the Communication Department , which is a member of WACC , since the new church 's beginning five years ago .
Object Design UK is headed up by managing director , James Beagle .
Established in 1990 , just two months after Multiflow closed its doors , Equator is headed up by ex-Multiflow vice president John O'Donnell .
The existing management , headed by chairman and chief executive Mike Smith , and all 1,950 staff , will remain intact .
